meanings.definition: The period of greatest success, popularity, or power.
meanings.sent1: During their heydays, the band sold out stadiums all over the world.
meanings.sent2: In the heydays of silent films, Charlie Chaplin was a beloved star.
meanings.sent3: The retirement home residents jokingly referred to their bingo nights as the heydays of their week.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins stood as a reminder of the heydays of a once-mighty civilization.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors and bustling streets captured the heydays of the city in its prime.

meanings.definition: A period of youthful exuberance or peak vitality.
meanings.sent1: The children spent their heydays playing in the park, full of energy and laughter.
meanings.sent2: During her heydays, Grandma used to dance all night at the local parties.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics during its heydays brought joy to the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The garden bloomed with flowers, symbolizing the heydays of spring's arrival.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's heydays were evident in the way he effortlessly ran the marathon.
